byline.contributor: Taimoor Shah contributed reporting from Kandahar, Afghanistan, and Fazal Muzhary and Mujib Mashal from Kabul.

abstract: Afghan officials report deaths of three important regional officials and at least nine others in three separate attacks by Taliban insurgents in southern Afghanistan; rise in number of attacks by Taliban is drawing American forces deeper into conflict since their combat role officially ended in 2014.
lead_paragraph: The attacks, which killed at least 12 people, came after an insurgents’ takeover of a strategic district in Helmand Province on Wednesday.

headline.main: Prominent Afghan Officials Are Killed by Taliban in 3 Attacks in South
headline.print_headline: 3 Prominent Afghan Officials Are Killed as Taliban Strike Targets in South

snippet: The attacks, which killed at least 12 people, came after an insurgents’ takeover of a strategic district in Helmand Province on Wednesday.
